pageContext.claim: “So when I went to Dayton, and when I went to El Paso, and I went into those hospitals, the love for me -- and me, maybe, as a representative of the country -- but for me -- and my love for them was unparalleled. These are incredible people. But if you read the papers, it was like nobody would meet with me. … Not only did they meet with me, they were pouring out of the room. The doctors were coming out of the operating rooms. There were hundreds and hundreds of people all over the floor. You couldn't even walk on it.”
pageContext.analysis: Spectacularly false. Trump was snubbed by victims of a mass shooting in El Paso, a border city with a large Hispanic population. Protestors denounced his harsh treatment of immigrants, the city's representative in Congress declined an invitation to join him on his visit, and "none of the eight patients still being treated at University Medical Center in El Paso agreed to meet with Trump when he visited the hospital," The Post reported.
